description.narrative: Facilities WASH: Package of sustainable WASH facilities and hygiene promotion in institutions modelled and scaled up nationally to contribute to CF environments and improved MCH. Generation of evidence to support national scale up and influence national education and health policies.

sector.narrative: Risk management and resilience/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Kenya United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Kenya Country Programme Document 7/2014-6/2018 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Kenya: Real Time Evaluation on Emergency Drought Situation Response in Kenya 2017
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Facilities WASH: Package of sustainable WASH facilities and hygiene promotion in institutions modelled and scaled up nationally to contribute to CF environments and improved MCH. Generation of evidence to support national scale up and influence national education and health policies.

description.narrative: WASH services were improved in 125 schools benefiting 54,915 children. Menstrual hygiene management was promoted in 29 schools. Leveraging resources for WASH in schools was achieved in 3 counties for a total of USD 330,000. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018

title.narrative: Number of schools with Menstrual Hygiene Management implemented in schools programmes as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes.
Number of pupils with access to basic WASH service in schools in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Schools at which WASH facilities have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
